title: Nonpoint Source Pollution Management and Control
context: [CHAPTER 342E] NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION MANAGEMENT AND CONTROL Section 342E-1 Definitions 342E-2 Nonpoint source pollution management and control program; rules 342E-3 Powers and duties of the director 342E-4 Civil penalties Note L 1993, c 345, ยง4 provides: &ldquo;SECTION 4. This [chapter] shall not be construed or interpreted to diminish the scope of chapter 342D, Hawaii Revised Statutes, or the authority of the director of health under chapter 342D.&rdquo; L 2014, c 218, ยง8 purports to amend this chapter. Department of transportation&rsquo;s bridge rehabilitation and replacement program; temporary exemption from certain construction requirements of this chapter through June 30, 2017 or until completion. L 2012, c 218. Cross References Environmental courts, jurisdiction over proceedings arising under this chapter, see ยง604A-2. Case Notes Department of health&rsquo;s (DOH) duties under the public trust doctrine requires the DOH to not only issue permits after prescribed measures appear to be in compliance with state regulation, but also to ensure that the prescribed measures are actually being implemented after a thorough assessment of the possible adverse impacts the development would have on the State&rsquo;s natural resources; this duty is consistent with the constitutional mandate under article XI, ยง1 of the Hawaii constitution and the duties imposed upon the DOH by chapter 342D and this chapter. 111 H. 205, 140 P.3d 985.
